stateCompliance.headline: Understanding Cash Advance Laws in St. Petersburg, Florida
stateCompliance.content: Residents of St. Petersburg are protected by Florida's comprehensive payday lending regulations, administered by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation's Division of Consumer Finance. Florida law is recognized for having some of the strongest consumer protections for payday loans in the United States. Cash advance loans are legal and heavily regulated to protect borrowers.
keyPoints: All payday lenders in St. Petersburg must be licensed by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation
You can only have one payday loan at a time in Florida, enforced by statewide database
Single-payment loans are capped at $500 with maximum 10% fee plus $5 verification fee
Installment loans are capped at $1,000 with maximum 8% biweekly fee on outstanding balance
You must wait 24 hours after paying off one loan before taking out another
Loan rollovers and extensions are prohibited by law
If you can't pay on time, you're entitled to a 60-day grace period with free credit counseling
You cannot be criminally prosecuted for an unpaid payday loan
Prepayment penalties are prohibited - you can pay off early without extra cost
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and should not be construed as legal or financial advice. Payday loan laws and regulations are subject to change. For the most accurate and up-to-date information about Florida payday loan regulations, please contact the Florida Office of Financial Regulation at (850) 487-9687 or visit flofr.gov. Consult with a licensed financial advisor or attorney regarding your specific situation before making borrowing decisions.

nearbyLocations.intro: Can't make it to our St. Petersburg location? We also serve these nearby cities:

faq.question: Where is your St. Petersburg cash advance location?
faq.answer: Our St. Petersburg branch is located at 145 2nd Avenue South, Suite 120, right downtown near Pier Park and the waterfront. We're easily accessible from I-275 Exit 24.

faq.question: What are your hours at the St. Petersburg location?
faq.answer: We're open Monday through Friday from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM, and Saturday 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM. We're closed on Sundays. Walk-ins are always welcome!

faq.question: How fast can I get cash at the St. Petersburg location?
faq.answer: Most customers get approved and leave with cash in 15-30 minutes. We're fast because we understand emergencies can't wait.

faq.question: What protections do St. Petersburg residents have?
faq.answer: Florida law provides excellent protections: caps on loan amounts ($500 for single-payment, $1,000 for installment), fee limits, a 60-day grace period with free credit counseling if you can't pay, and prohibition on criminal prosecution for unpaid loans.

faq.question: Can I pay off my St. Petersburg cash advance early?
faq.answer: Yes! Florida law prohibits prepayment penalties. You can pay off your loan early without any extra fees or charges.
